<https://sites.google.com/a/android.com/tools/recent/androidstudio14preview1incanarychannel|Android Studio 1.4 Preview 1 in Canary Channel>
We've just released 1.4 Preview 1 to the canary channel! In addition to a large number of bug fixes, 1.4 contains the following new features:A new theme editor, which helps you view, explore and edit your themes. (In this first version, only color and color state-lists are included.) You can access the theme editor from your styles.xml file.<a href="<https://sites.google.com/a/android.com/tools/recent/androidstudio14preview1incanarychannel/theme-editor.png?attredirects=0>"...

of happiness
I still don’t use the translations editor. Wonder if I will start using this.
that’s because translations editor is effectively useless if you know how to xml
i actually keep sections in my strings.xml based on the section of the app… that probably gets lost in translation editor too
<@U0546QERR>: I keep sections too. Each section has a comment header.
<@U0546QERR>: Wtf are you talking about
That translation editor is freaking awesome
I paid 30 bucks to get Linguian so I had something similar for ios
None of your organization gets lost at all

what does it do besides put the translations next to each other? in all fairness I've never had to actually translate something, but I was under the impression you just copy/paste the english file and work through each string one by one
also i haven't checked it out since the first day i got that notification in AS, maybe they've added features

opened it up again, it’s the same as before. I can see the value if you’re one person doing 3 different translations, but as for my commented section headers, I can’t see those in the editor so I have no idea about the context for a particular string
It shows you exactly what translations you are missing etc. It’s really really nice to have
And lets you tweak all the files super easy
You ever translate an app, and you will fall in love pretty easily
Like I said, I paid for Linguain just so I could have the same thing for iOS
Do you translate your own apps? I don’t..
Yeah..
Or have a system for it where I get things back in a particular format
When you work for a company, they send out a file, and then all the platforms and get a single file back. It’s up to each platform to incorporate them.
So iOS, Web, Android, Backend all get the same file and have to put it in appropriately.
Android always wins
As in time?
And ease.
Why not write a script that does that for you?
Especially if you get back two or three at a time
Creates and modifies the XML?
I translate mine (normally, not in the beginning) to Dutch, French and German
If the main file is in a structured format.
Then why not?
i think lint checks if you are missing translations, doesn’t it?
Yes
Putting them next to each other helps a great deal
yeah if you’re andreas and know that many languages i can see the value
It shows you how something is worded in another language
It’s an easy script, but it’s the added feature from it.
i figured most people just do the one other that they know
